description: Verify the compile-test-rescore cycle, regression detection, and fix idempotency for db-fix.

tests.name: Compile + Test Verification
tests.prompt: Apply the FK Index fix and verify Prisma validation, compilation, and tests pass
tests.setup: Scorecard with HIGH issue: missing indexes on foreign key columns (Indexing 3/10). Apply the FK Index fix from `performance-scaling.md` which adds `@@index` directives to the Prisma schema.
expectations: Run `npx prisma validate` to confirm schema syntax
Run `npx prisma generate` to regenerate the client
Run `npx tsc --noEmit`. Verify zero type errors after client regeneration
Run `pnpm test`. Verify all existing DB query tests still pass
tests.pass_criteria: `prisma validate` exits 0. `tsc --noEmit` exits 0 after `prisma generate`. All tests pass. Migration preview (`prisma migrate dev --create-only`) shows only `CREATE INDEX` statements, no table drops.
fail_indicators: Schema validation error, type mismatch from regenerated client, or migration preview includes destructive operations (DROP COLUMN, DROP TABLE)

tests.name: Re-Score Improvement Verification
tests.prompt: Apply fixes for Indexing and Schema Design categories and verify re-score improvement
tests.setup: Initial db-scoring scorecard: Indexing 3/10, Schema Design 5/10, Security 4/10. Total 48/100 (D+). Apply fixes for FK indexes (Indexing) and `@@unique` constraints on email fields (Schema Design).
expectations: Invoke `db-scoring` to produce a new scorecard
Compare per-category scores: Indexing, Schema Design must increase
Verify Security, Operations, Query Performance, and all other categories remain at or above pre-fix scores
tests.pass_criteria: Indexing >= 6/10 (was 3). Schema Design >= 7/10 (was 5). No category dropped below its pre-fix score. Total weighted score increased. EXPLAIN on key queries shows index usage.
fail_indicators: Any unfixed category score decreased, or EXPLAIN still shows sequential scans on indexed columns

tests.name: Regression Detection
tests.prompt: Apply a schema fix that introduces a Migration & Versioning regression and verify pipeline detects it
tests.setup: Initial scorecard: Schema Design 8/10, Indexing 7/10, Migration & Versioning 7/10. Apply a schema fix that renames a column without a migration rename step, causing `prisma migrate dev` to generate DROP + ADD instead of ALTER RENAME. Migration & Versioning drops from 7/10 to 3/10.
expectations: Apply schema fix that renames `userName` to `displayName` without using `@map`
Verify pipeline detects Migration & Versioning dropped from 7 to 3 (delta -4)
Verify pipeline halts and recommends using `@map("userName")` to preserve data
tests.pass_criteria: Pipeline detects the Migration & Versioning regression. Output flags: destructive migration detected, before/after delta shown, recommendation to use `@map` for safe column rename. Pipeline does not continue.
fail_indicators: Pipeline ignores the destructive migration and continues, or fails to detect the DROP + ADD pattern in migration SQL

tests.name: Fix Idempotency
tests.prompt: Run db-fix with an already-fixed FK indexing issue and verify no changes are made
tests.setup: Scorecard with HIGH issue: missing FK indexes. The `prisma/schema.prisma` already has `@@index([userId])` on all models from a previous fix run.
expectations: Run db-fix with the same indexing issue
Check `git diff` after the fix attempt
Run `npx prisma migrate dev --create-only` and verify no new migration is generated
tests.pass_criteria: No files modified (`git diff` is empty). No new migration created ("Already in sync"). Skill reports "already applied" or "no changes needed." No duplicate `@@index` directives.
fail_indicators: Duplicate `@@index([userId])` lines added, empty migration file created, or schema validation fails from duplicate directives
